intro: Dryas ajanensis var. incanescens, commonly known as the silverleaf mountain avens, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The leaves are typically covered in a dense layer of silvery-white hairs, giving the plant its common name. The flowers are small, pink to white, and arranged in clusters, blooming in early summer. This species is adapted to cold, rocky environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
